member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Console
member.summary: The console object provides access to the browser's debugging console (e.g. the Web Console in Firefox). The specifics of how it works vary from browser to browser, but there is a de facto set of features that are typically provided.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Log(System.String)
member.summary: Outputs a message to the Web Console.
member.param: Object to output.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Log(System.Enum)
member.summary: Outputs a message to the Web Console.
member.param: Object to output.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Log(System.Char)
member.summary: Outputs a message to the Web Console.
member.param: Object to output.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Log(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Outputs a message to the Web Console.
member.param: Object to output.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Log(System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Outputs a message to the Web Console.
member.param: Object to output.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Log(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Outputs a message to the Web Console.
member.param: A JavaScript string containing zero or more substitution strings.
JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Log(System.Object[])
member.summary: Outputs a message to the Web Console.
member.param: JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Info(System.String)
member.summary: Outputs an informational message to the Web Console. In Firefox, a small "i" icon is displayed next to these items in the Web Console's log.
member.param: A JavaScript string containing zero or more substitution strings.

member.summary: Outputs an informational message to the Web Console. In Firefox, a small "i" icon is displayed next to these items in the Web Console's log.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Group
member.summary: Creates a new inline group, indenting all following output by another level. To move back out a level, call groupEnd().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Group(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new inline group, indenting all following output by another level. To move back out a level, call groupEnd().
member.param: A message.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Group(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new inline group, indenting all following output by another level. To move back out a level, call groupEnd().
member.param: A message.
JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Group(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new inline group, indenting all following output by another level. To move back out a level, call groupEnd().
member.param: JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.GroupCollapsed
member.summary: Creates a new inline group in the Web Console. Unlike console.group(), however, the new group is created collapsed. The user will need to use the disclosure button next to it to expand it, revealing the entries created in the group.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.GroupCollapsed(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new inline group in the Web Console. Unlike console.group(), however, the new group is created collapsed. The user will need to use the disclosure button next to it to expand it, revealing the entries created in the group.
member.param: A message.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.GroupCollapsed(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new inline group in the Web Console. Unlike console.group(), however, the new group is created collapsed. The user will need to use the disclosure button next to it to expand it, revealing the entries created in the group.
member.param: A message.
An array of objects to write to the group.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.GroupCollapsed(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a new inline group in the Web Console. Unlike console.group(), however, the new group is created collapsed. The user will need to use the disclosure button next to it to expand it, revealing the entries created in the group.
member.param: An array of objects to write to the group.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.GroupEnd
member.summary: Exits the current inline group.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Assert(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Log a message and stack trace to console if first argument is false.
member.param: If false then message is shown

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Assert(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Log a message and stack trace to console if first argument is false.
member.param: If false then message is shown
A JavaScript string containing zero or more substitution strings.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Assert(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Log a message and stack trace to console if first argument is false.
member.param: If false then message is shown
A JavaScript string containing zero or more substitution strings.
JavaScript objects with which to replace substitution strings within msg. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Trace
member.summary: Outputs a stack trace.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Time(System.Object)
member.summary: Starts a timer with a name specified as an input parameter. Up to 10,000 simultaneous timers can run on a given page.
member.param: The name to give the new timer. This will identify the timer; use the same name when calling console.timeEnd() to stop the timer and get the time output to the console.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.TimeEnd(System.Object)
member.summary: Stops the specified timer and logs the elapsed time in seconds since its start.
member.param: The name of the timer to stop. Once stopped, the elapsed time is automatically displayed in the Web Console.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.TimeStamp(System.Object)
member.summary: This method adds an event to the Timeline during a recording session. This lets you visually correlate your code generated time stamp to other events, such as screen layout and paints, that are automatically added to the Timeline.
member.param: Stamp name

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Profile
member.summary: Starts the JavaScript profiler. You can specify an optional label for the profile.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Profile(System.String)
member.summary: Starts the JavaScript profiler. You can specify an optional label for the profile.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.ProfileEnd
member.summary: Stops the profiler.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Count
member.summary: Logs the number of times that this particular call to count() has been called. This function takes an optional argument label. If label is supplied, this function logs the number of times count() has been called with that particular label. If label is omitted, the function logs the number of times count() has been called at this particular line.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Count(System.String)
member.summary: Logs the number of times that this particular call to count() has been called. This function takes an optional argument label. If label is supplied, this function logs the number of times count() has been called with that particular label. If label is omitted, the function logs the number of times count() has been called at this particular line.
member.param: Label value

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Dir(System.Object)
member.summary: Displays an interactive listing of the properties of a specified JavaScript object. This listing lets you use disclosure triangles to examine the contents of child objects.
member.param: A JavaScript object whose properties should be output.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Table(System.Object)
member.summary: Displays tabular data as a table.
member.param: The data to display. This must be either an array or an object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Console.Table(System.Object,System.String[])
member.summary: Displays tabular data as a table.
member.param: The data to display. This must be either an array or an object.
An array containing the names of columns to include in the output.
